Handling large datasets with over 300,000 ASIN records manually using Excel's VLOOKUP is impractical due to performance issues, so a Python script, Asin_filter.py, was developed to automate the process, efficiently identifying common ASINs and bypassing Excel's limitations.

One-stop diagnostic tool to troubleshoot catalog issues that are owned by GCSS.
User guide: https://w.amazon.com/bin/view/GCSS/Catalog_Troubleshooter/User_guide
Demo video: https://broadcast.amazon.com/videos/392041
Robot usage metrics: https://w.amazon.com/bin/view/GCSS/Documentation/GCSS_Robot_Metrics/
BLADE tool is used by RBS in self service to unlink the barcodes. GCSS raised OP1 request to implement the features in SC: https://issues.amazon.com/SCP2021OPIntake-213
reason_for_cut:
Last updated on 2020-11-18:

 The barcode model used by Matching Service which causes this necessary approval process is under review/redesign in https://issues.amazon.com/issues/CSSOP2021-302.
 Building a new system to manage approvals over particular attributes is not the right approach here. Future contributions will be protected by the SHIELD system.

description:
These scripts are used to reassign tickets between T4, GCSS and Development resolver groups
 1.Reassign tickets to GCSS resolver group if ticket is directly raised to Development group
 2.Reassign tickets to T4 resolver group if ticket is directly raised to GCSS group
 3.If a ticket is not raised with proper tool links then the ticket will get resolved
remarks: This is in the path of deprecation and getting replaced by AutoSIM rules, but there are some edge cases which are not being covered in the AutoSIM, so we are using reassigner scripts for those cases

description: Deprecation UI is a self service UI to process deprecation, ipq change and unmerge. GCSS raised OP1 request to automate the features in ARM https://issues.amazon.com/issues/IA2020OP-7
reason_for_cut:
Last update on 2022-06-16:

 Although we have marked this ticket as "committed (scope need to be defined)" there are some challenges with timelines and dependencies with the downstream systems for this change (only for Usecase 1 and Usecase 3). As a basic platform preparation, we already have in-progress work for enabling self service for Bulk merge this year as priority since it will pave the path for enabling retail bulk merge by easily extending it to retail bulk merge as well. The dependencies for this work to complete in 2023 will be with confirmation from the downstream dependencies and readiness for API consumption.
 To summarise, we will start planning to work on this request based on above details and priorities and will have dependencies with external teams like ARADOR to successfully complete this work within 2023.
reason_for_catalog_access: To process ASIN deprecation and unmerge

description: One-stop diagnostic tool to troubleshoot brand normalization related issues for an ASIN.Ticket reduction details and robot metrics are documented here -https://w.amazon.com/bin/view/GCSS/Documentation/GCSS_Diagnostics/GCSS_Developed_Robots/BONSAI_ROBOT/.

As they dont have technical skills to maintain the tool, GCSS is continued to provide support for high priority requests. Long term option is to move the complete ownershipt to SM - BONSAI Ops team

description: About GCSS ChatbotGCSS Chatbot is a self-service tool to empower you to find the right resources/answers to your day-to-day questions within the scope of GCSS. The automatic and interactive tool was created in 2022.Why a Chatbot?From the recent ticket analysis, we observed that (1) 30% of tickets (3269 out of 11036) are related to not using the tool or users followed the tool correctly or issues getting self-resolved; (2) 6% of tickets (662 out of 11036) are raised because Customers are not aware of an ongoing system level issue. These learning gap tickets can be Self-resolved, if they get proper guidance. By using our Chatbot; a 24/7 interactive and automated response mechanism, it will help you to spend more time with customers and help find proper information more efficiently.About the ChatbotGCSS Chatbot provides an interactive way for Catalog issues to seek help and find information at any time. It is automated and stores a list of frequently asked questions (1000+). When these common questions are asked, the chatbot will point to resources and useful information. With the new Chatbot, teams can spend more time and energy with our customers and thereby increase their productivity and save our TAT and Knowledge gap tickets to GCSS.‚è∞ 24/7 availability.‚ö° Quick replies within seconds.üòä Has infinite patience. It never sleeps, turns up late or grumpy.üí¨ Transform your FAQs into an interactive conversational experience.üéØ Freeing up people's time, so teams can work on more added value tasks

In GCSS, Engineers spend ~70% of their time on tickets/SIMs and spend ~30% of their time on other tasks such as redrives, legal escalations, policy risks and host/environment issues. We did not have a proper mechanism to measure and track the 30% efforts spent on other tasks. This caused a problem in measuring the total efforts of the team and individual‚Äôs performance metrics. GCSS implemented the GCSS Effort Tracking UI to capture the un-tracked efforts and display total efforts of the team in one place. In this tool: (1) SEs can log their efforts for every task they work on; (2) Displays total efforts of an individual SE in a particular period; (3) Provides complete team efforts for GCSS managers with categorization.
